channel.title: C# Questions(2)
channel.description:
Hello all,
I am starting a project in C# and I'm brainstorming ideas and things that I can include in the game, and I'm stuck on a few things. It's going to be a console application that has arrow key controls, text based commands, and reflex commands. And my questions are:
How do I create and get/give information to a database? I want to create a large database filled with text commands and such(Commands, items, locations, etc...). How would I create a database to access these files and be able to change properties and such within the database? [code] Location HasBeenTo Room5 true[/code] Kind of like that. Get variables for a room, like if you have been there. If there are items there, and so on. I was thinking that it would be best for me to learn XML for that? But I'm not totally sure if XML can do what I want. Such as change and write to the XML file. Can that be done?
And my second question is this:
What is the default value for Char? For my reflex controls I'm going to be running multiple threads at a time. So I want to declare a character variable and then have the user press any key before a timer of say 1 second runs out. And I wanted to have the checking system as easy as [code]if (charval != null) break;[/code]. Is there any way to check for a default character value like this?
All help is appreciated. (And links for any tutorials)
